head.title: POSTINGS: Programs From City's Housing Agency; Learning to Be A Homeowner

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: Programs From City's Housing Agency; Learning to Be A Homeowner

abstract.p: New York City Housing Preservation and Development Department schedules series of seminars and for homeowners and landlords (S)

block.p: Programs aimed at providing homeowners and landlords with the information they need to properly manage their properties will be presented at various locations in the city throughout September.

Next Wednesday the city Department of Housing Preservation and Development will offer seminars on home maintenance at its Neighborhood Housing Services offices in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island. On Thursday a class on residential property management and building systems will be given at the department's main office in Manhattan.
Programs aimed at providing homeowners and landlords with the information they need to properly manage their properties will be presented at various locations in the city throughout September.

Next Wednesday the city Department of Housing Preservation and Development will offer seminars on home maintenance at its Neighborhood Housing Services offices in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island. On Thursday a class on residential property management and building systems will be given at the department's main office in Manhattan.

Other events include a Homebuyers Fair on Sept. 23 at Madison Square Garden sponsored by Fannie Mae, the mortgage financing corporation, as well as H.P.D. seminars on water and energy conservation, advanced building systems operations and landlord-tenant relations.

Four walking tours of H.P.D.-sponsored housing developments are scheduled, one for the Bushwick section of Brooklyn on Saturday and others later in the month in Jamaica, Queens, the Melrose section of the Bronx and Harlem.
The events are being presented under the umbrella of the city's ''Homeowners Month.''
Event times, dates and sites can be obtained by calling (212) 863-8000 or by visiting H.P.D.'s Web site at www.nyc.gov/html/hpd.
